choices.C: The record remains in the system for reporting purposes only
choices.A: The record is marked inactive but remains in the system
choices.D: The record is removed from the system
choices.B: The record state is set to In use

questions.question_text: What happens to the consumable's asset record after it has been consumed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C seems to be correct answer

Selected Answer: C
Page 176 of Vancouver HAMF text

Selected Answer: C
C 
As per NowLearning - Consumables: Managing Consumable Assets: 
After a consumable is consumed, the record remains in the system for reporting purposes.

Selected Answer: C
Verified via ServiceNow Docs: "After a consumable is consumed, the record remains in the system for reporting purposes."

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/task/t_ConsumingConsumableAssets.html#:~:text=If%20a%20consumable%20is%20not,the%20system%20for%20reporting%20purposes.

You can cancel a contract when the State is Active.

questions.question_text: A contract can be cancelled when the State is what?

choices.D: The most recent scan is imported

questions.question_text: During an inventory audit, what happens if you accidentally scan the same asset twice?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer

Selected Answer: C
Page 395 of HAMF Vancouver

Selected Answer: C
C
As per NowLearning - Mobile Asset Management: 
On the review page, you can delete assets if needed. However, HAM automatically removes duplicates for assets that you accidentally scan multiple times.

Selected Answer: C
Verified via docs: "Tip: On the review page, you can delete assets if needed. However, Hardware Asset Management automatically removes duplicates for assets that you accidentally scan twice." 

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/hardware-asset-management/task/audit-asset-inventory.html

questions.question_text: A blind inventory audit is typically initiated via which interface?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. Now Agent Mobile app
Explanation: ServiceNow Agent app: Use the ServiceNow Agent app to create assets, look up assets, and receive assets from a purchase order.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/administer/mobile-my-asset/concept/mobile-my-asset.html

comments.content:
a better explanation
Explanation: The asset or inventory_user role can only access the Asset Audits [sn_hamp_asset_audit] reports.
 - Hardware Asset Management
 - ServiceNow Agent app

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/hardware-asset-management/task/audit-your-inventory.html
